page.title: 08NORTH HYKEHAM LIBRARY
page.content: North Hykeham library has about 5210 members which are a mixture of youny childen and adults. The libary encourages people to use the library by giving talks in schools to the children. The Library first opened in 1969 and was extended in 1984. Before this a back room of the Church Hall was used. The library was paid for by the County Council. This money comes from the rates that our parents have to pay. The Council employ six people to run the library. The library is much better now that it has been extended and refurnished, making it an attractive building. It is also conveniently situated in the old village part of the town. Some people think it should have been built nearer to the centre of the town.
